refnamediv.refpurpose: Set of all elements, rows, or columns of two arrays, without duplicates

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: [v, ka, kb] = union(a, b) [v, ka, kb] = union(a, b, orient)

varlistentry.listitem: arrays of booleans, numbers, or text. Sparse boolean or numerical matrices are accepted. The types of a and of b can be distinct but compatible for concatenation.

orientation of the processing:
1 or "r": the union is performed over the rows.
2 or "c": the union is performed over the columns.
row vector, or matrix. v's data type is the type of [a(:) ; b(:)]'s result.
row vector of integers: Indices in a of v elements/rows/columns coming from a.
row vector of integers: Indices in b of v remaining elements/rows/columns coming from b.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: union(a,b) returns a sorted row vector which retains the unique entries of [a(:) ; b(:)].

union(a,b,"r") or union(a,b,1)returns the matrix formed by the union of the unique rows of a and b sorted in lexicographic ascending order. In this case matrices a and b must have the same number of columns.

union(a,b,"c") or union(a,b,2)returns the matrix formed by the union of the unique columns of a and b sorted in lexicographic ascending order. In this case matrices a and b must have the same number of rows.
[v,ka,kb]=union(a,b) also returns index vectors ka and kb such that v is a sorted combination of the entries a(ka) and b(kb).

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.screen:
--> A = sparse([T T F T F T ; F F F F T T ; T F F F F T ]); full(A) ans = T T F T F T F F F F T T T F F F F T
--> B = sparse([F F T T F F ; T T T T T T ; T F T T T F ]); full(B) ans = F F T T F F T T T T T T T F T T T F
--> [U, ka, kb] = union(A, B, "c"); --> issparse(U) ans = T
--> full(U), ka, kb ans = F F F T T T F T T F F T F F T F T T
ka = 3. 5. 2. 1. 6. kb = 1.

revision.revdescription: Extension to sparse boolean, sparse real, and sparse complex matrices.
